subject: Re: number of testcase instances created
msgSnippet: thanks.  i know there is no guarantee to the order of processing the test methods, but do they run simultaneously or serially?  i just have setup data that
messageBody:
thanks. i know there is no guarantee to the order of
processing the test methods, but do they run simultaneously
or serially? i just have setup data that needs to be set
in the db prior to each one running .. dont want each test
method to step on the others modifications.

--- In junit@y..., Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@f...> wrote:
> 5
> yes
>
> =jason
>
> On Fri, 2002-11-01 at 14:40, global_explorer wrote: if i have a
testcase
> that has 5 test methods, does the framework
> create 1 instance of your testcase and then execute each test
method
> on that instance (calling setUp/tearDown around each) .. or does it
> create an instance for each test method (5 instances in this
example)
> and call a method on each instance (setUp/tearDown called once on
> each instance's method)?
>
> also, if an assertion fails, will the tearDown run afterward?
>
>
>
>
>
